hypothesis_content.title: Pre-Announcement Volatility Suppression Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: During the 2-hour window before major scheduled events (Fed, CPI, ETF flows announcement), if BTC 15-minute realized volatility drops below 50% of its daily average while price remains within ±0.5% of the event window open, the initial post-announcement spike (first 5 minutes) will fade in the opposite direction within 30 minutes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Market makers and algos suppress volatility pre-announcement to manage gamma risk. The initial spike often represents liquidity-seeking flows that exhaust quickly, followed by reversion as market makers re-hedge and actual information gets processed.
entry_conditions: Major scheduled event within 2 hours (identifiable via calendar)
Price within ±0.5% of event window open price
Enter opposite direction of initial 5-minute post-announcement move once 5-minute candle closes

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to event window open ±0.25%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Initial move continues beyond 1.5x its first 5-minute range

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If post-announcement trend continues beyond 45 minutes more than 40% of the time, or if pre-event volatility doesn't predict fade direction.
